posts.body:
>>3242b20c-51d0-425d-bbbc-c6f370e8a44f
> I think this is because posts you already downloaded works fine, but when you download a new, it won't accept the ones with the old certificate.
No way to fix that?
It's pretty shit having several thousand post missing and them clogging the update queue and spamming the console with cert errors.

>>789cd8ba-ec99-4588-a2c0-b038926d460d
>I think it could be fixed by temporalily adding the old cert_signers, but I don't know what is it and this zeronet documentation is hilariously shit. Am I supposed to read through the full bitcoin specification to figure out how to get it?
Looking at it, might just be the cert_signer section of 1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9/data/users/content.json 
Might probably just need to add what was there before the site removed the ability to post with self signed certs?

>>2d91b11f-d56e-4a3e-9fe3-53e892cf2f2d
> I would enable logging of everything and see what zeronet says being seemingly "idle".. log is in zeronet/log/debug.log file.
data/users/1L1T3NWYD7nsva4Pt8r5m3tVwHqEvoHtDJ/content.json: verify sign error: VerifyError: Invalid cert signer: 08chan in ContentManager.py line 979 > ContentManager.py line 821
Ad nauseam for every content.json

>>7415f21f-19fb-40ba-ac90-9bb737269184
> It may not help, i do not know.
Well now it has 2.6k files waiting to download instead of 1.2k so I guess that's something, still the same spam in the console
but yeah like >>9402f6fa-fa0a-4446-9bbe-c91c95696a13 said something is wrong, and I don't know how or care to disable cert validation to redownload the shit I'm missing right now.

>>f813708a-34f0-478f-b4e1-199042c61381
So everything prior to the switch is basically gone unless you have it downloaded already is what you're saying?

>>96f47cb6-e228-4639-b53b-a674e7aeeffb
Well doesn't that pose a long term problem with zeronet basically constantly trying to get files it will have to reject?
